channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: NHS Wales: Waiting times and A&E at worst performance level
item.description: Numbers waiting for hospital treatment and A&E waiting times are the worst on record.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer 'won't interfere' with Labour-Plaid talks
item.description: The UK Labour leader says he will not get involved with talks between Mark Drakeford and Plaid Cymru.

item.title: Pembrokeshire man, 81, suffocated his wife before suicide
item.description: David Arnold sent a letter outlining his intention to kill his wife.

item.title: Swansea driver with Covid charged Â£45 to change speed course date
item.description: Norman Taylor says he was asked to pay the fee when he could not attend a class on falling ill.

item.title: Carmarthenshire dog rescue: More than 200 taken from unlicensed breeder
item.description: One charity says the animals were in the most heart-breaking and appalling conditions it had seen.

item.title: Bangor 1876 v Menai Bridge Tigers - is this the most local derby in British football?
item.description: Welsh clubs Bangor 1876 and Menai Bridge Tigers' home grounds are now just 40 yards apart.

item.title: Car spotted driving down Cardiff traffic-free cycleway
item.description: "Clearly this is wildly unsafe and against the law," a witness says.

item.title: Dylan Garbe-Ashton: Police cleared after Powys man's death
item.description: Dylan Garbe-Ashton had a seizure and hit his head in a police station after earlier taking cocaine.

item.title: GP appointments in Wales: People facing crisis, says watchdog
item.description: By the time Becca Martin's family got an appointment for her dad, he was so ill he was taken to hospital.

item.title: Wylfa: Talks on new Anglesey nuclear plant proposals
item.description: Government official says there are discussions with groups wanting to build new reactor in Anglesey.

item.title: Covid: Children 'may be more susceptible to common illnesses this winter'
item.description: An expert warns children may be more susceptible this winter because of an "immunity debt".

item.title: Meat-free Monday for island's primary schools sparks row
item.description: Councillors and farming unions question the new menu for a county's infants and juniors.

item.title: Paralympic hopes: Disabled boxing classes 'changes lives'
item.description: A veteran who was injured in service now teaches people with disabilities how to box.

item.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK: Meet Cardiff's Victoria Scone
item.description: She is the first female act to appear on RuPaul's Drag Race UK.

item.title: 'I have stage four cancer but avoided chemotherapy'
item.description: Kate Molton has stage four lung cancer - but will not need chemotherapy.

item.title: Wales' ambulance crews struggle with 'worst-ever' crisis
item.description: An ambulance worker says morale is low as hospitals struggle to cope with patient numbers.

item.title: Newport pupil looking for university 'suitable for black people'
item.description: People from minority or poorer backgrounds are less likely to be offered a place at Welsh universities.

item.title: Ceredigion: Plea to stay away from seals after pup death
item.description: People are warned not to approach seals after a pup died after visitors scared its mother away.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: How will the 16 sides fare?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the chances of all 16 sides ahead of this season's new United Rugby Championship (URC) tournament.

item.title: Welsh Rugby Union: Bank debt rises to Â£22.9m despite Â£400,000 profit for financial year
item.description: The Welsh Rugby Union says it has recorded a small Â£400,000 profit before tax despite the Covid-19 pandemic - but overall bank debt has risen to Â£22.9m and net debt to Â£114.4m.

item.title: Welsh Rugby Union promises reform in women's game
item.description: The Welsh Rugby Union (WRU) says mistakes made in the women's game will be put right.

item.title: Romelu Lukaku calls for players' summit with social media companies to tackle racism
item.description: Romelu Lukaku says footballers should take "stronger positions" on racism than just taking the knee and wants social media companies to meet players.

item.title: Steve Thompson to donate brain for chronic traumatic encephalopathy research
item.description: Rugby World Cup winner Steve Thompson, who was diagnosed with dementia aged 42, will donate his brain to scientists researching brain trauma.

item.title: Adrannau brys yn cofnodi'u ffigyrau gwaethaf erioed eto
item.description: Ffigyrau perfformiad gwaethaf erioed wedi cael eu cofnodi unwaith eto gan adrannau brys ysbytai Cymru.

item.description: Llywodraeth y DU yn cynnal trafodaethau 'cychwynnol' gyda chwmnÃ¯au sy'n cynnig datblygu safle Wylfa.

item.title: Llafur a Phlaid Cymru: dim 'ymyrryd' gan Keir Starmer
item.description: Yn gynharach yr wythnos hon dywedodd Syr Keir Starmer fod cenedlaetholdeb yn niweidio'r DU.

item.title: Timau newydd, rheolau newydd... tymor rygbi newydd
item.description: Gohebydd rygbi BBC Cymru Cennydd Davies sy'n esbonio beth sy'n wynebu rhanbarthau Cymru y tymor hwn.

item.title: Surrey yn taro 'nÃ´l yn erbyn Morgannwg ar yr Oval
item.description: Mae hi'n edrych yn anochel bellach mai gÃªm gyfartal fydd hi wedi i'r tÃ®m cartref fatio trwy'r trydydd diwrnod.
